title: Bug 23267[Import/Export] Import Project should have a default folder
description: Bug 23267[Import/Export] Import Project should have a default folder
OB: When importing an existing Eclipse project on XP and clicking the Browse button, a dialog is displayed. However, this dialog does not have a designated default folder. Instead, it shows options such as the desktop and my computer. It should either have a default folder assigned, such as the default content location, or prompt the user to select a folder.
EB: When importing an existing Eclipse project on XP and clicking the Browse button, a dialog should be displayed with a default folder pre-selected. This default folder can be set to the default content location or any other appropriate location.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open Eclipse on XP.
2. Go to the import feature.
3. Click on the 'Browse' button to select a folder for importing the project.

Expected behavior:
- The dialog should open with a default folder pre-selected, such as the default content location.

Note: The issue is specific to the Windows XP operating system.
